text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the fire report being 'sufficient and suitable' is the responsibility of the owner if the report has been incorrectly completed by the third-party inspector. The candidate answer addresses this directly in Section 2 (B) and Section 3 (A) by stating: 'The ultimate responsibility still lies with you as the RP (FSO 2005, Art. 9(7))' regarding the FRA, and under Section 2 (B) it notes the failure of the FRA as a potential liability for the owner, implying the owner remains responsible for the sufficiency of the report despite using a third party.", "criterion_id": "96af97b1-4044-42bb-9b71-15102a04a27e"}
